comments.text: A working class lady got me to the next town, where I started my hike.
Within the first two minutes, two drivers offered me a ride to the next town, Sant Joan, but I waited a little longer and got a ride from a delivery truck driver straight to my destination.
Within the first two minutes, two drivers offered me a ride to the next town, Sant Joan, but I waited a little longer and got a ride from a delivery truck driver straight to my destination.
A working class lady got me to the next town, where I started my hike.

It took quite a while to get ride, but weâ€™re two guys. Our sign was to Barcelona, but we got ride to BenicarlÃ³. Thereâ€™s faucet for water and toilet close so itâ€™s good place. Also some hills where you can camp like us. The view was pretty nice.

If youâ€™re traveling alone, thereâ€™s plenty of trucks to ask for rides.

The main description above is fairly accurate, except the first road at the supermarket stops being the CV-306 and becomes the CV-3007. Turn left directly after the autovia exit, follow the small road, but when the road joins another road, turn left about 200 metres after. You will see graffiti on the wall by Vora and Picayo:
https://www.google.com/maps/@39.6447925,-0.2971526,3a,37.5y,331.07h,76.47t/data=!3m6!1e1!3m4!1sKyi7gcngeQWtGUl66Wwe8w!2e0!7i13312!8i6656

me + Nicol

from Malaga,ES to Prague,CZ

16-17:15 10.8.2015

After one hour of asking truckers and family cars, we got a hike to Barcelona. Two old Catalunyan intelectualls with a grandson who tought me how to solve the Rubik's Cube.

This is a wonderfull spot but still hiking in Spain takes more time than in France/Germany.

Sagunt

A big station known by truckers and visited by tourists and families.
Best place to hike north (Zaragoza or Barcelona and France) from Valencia.
(This is exact location of Sagunt, direction north.)

Getting here requires some time and knowledge:

Go from Valencia to PuÃ§ol(Puzol) by...
A) a yellow bus 115A (1,55â‚¬) or
B) a train C6 from Station Nord (around 20min, 2,65â‚¬).
Once in Puzol, ask for the roundabout (redonda) on the "carretera de Barcelona". Here is a cheap supermarket. Go on nor

Bon spot, deux chauffeurs en trente minutes. Jâ€™ai acceptÃ© un trajet jusquâ€™Ã  El Ejido mais jâ€™aurais peut-Ãªtre pu trouver quelquâ€™un qui allait plus loin. Possible de camper dans le dÃ©sert derriÃ¨re si besoin (attention aux sangliers paraÃ®t-il). 
Attention pas dâ€™eau ni rien dâ€™autre Ã  proximitÃ©.

PERFECT spot for going west! We (2 people) has 7 cars stop in 10 minutes, all going to aguadulce or roquetas. We were trying to get to Granada so we waited and eventually took a ride to Ejido (which I recommend against...get a ride to AT LEAST Motril)

I was extremely lucky and waited only 2 minutes for a jolly Spanish family to take me all the way to Sevilla. I was waiting at around 4 on a Friday afternoon so managed to go with the weekend travellers but a very good spot, with space for cars to pull over - they also slow down and can see you as they go around the roundabout.
Good spot, our driver was kind enough to take us to Bolonia from here, even though he wasn't meant to go there.
Amazing place. Waited less than 1 minute!
Very good spot to get out of El Medano! Never waited long there and used it sevreal times.
Plenty of place to stop, most cars going towards motorway. Easy to get a ride and then continue from motorway petrol stations to your destination. It beats waiting for and paying the guaguas!

Great spot for finding trucks. All the ones I found were going to eastern, not northern Europe. I ended up not finding a ride, but met nice drivers who shared their food and beer and stories. :) As it is a port area, maybe some way to check ship arrival times.
Large port area, highly reccomend for finding a truck out of Valencia. Subway goes to Sagunto then it's an hours walk to the port (also a bus that goes some of the way I believe)
We wanted to go to Porto but then decided to change to ValenÃ§a and we waited just 2 minutes. Then, from ValenÃ§a we caught another car to Porto
Great spot for Salamanca, had a (bad) sign saying "Salamanca" and the third car passing me took me all the way there. :)
Super good. A couple took us for a very long ride from here to Portugal
Many people
Set up my tent nearby.
Stood right at the roundabout in direction of Barcelona. A car stopped amd took me to GavÃ  station and gave me a train ticket to Barcelona. Lovely people around. Recommended spot
Best place to A CoruÃ±a <3
With the thumb, a car took us very quickly, direction west
Ride to the north wait around 1hour to get a lift to Saragossa. Nice place to start with people going in both directions
Best petrol station to go to the north or south! Huge amount of trucks and cars. A lot of morrocans going south so you might be able to catch a ride with them. You can get here from seville by bus.
Instant ride to the gas station in Toro, by a nice truck driver. Place is nice, looooots of place to stop, good visibility. Really great
From the exit of the petrol station, it was probably the third car that stopped - we got super lucky, they were going to MÃ¡laga and were happy to drop us off in Nerja.
I have hitched from here towards Granada a few times, sometimes alone and sometimes with a friend. Usually the wait is 10-15 minutes.
Got stranded by missed bus connection on the way to El Chorro for climbing. Got picked up by a bmw which was a shock. Used a sign from the bins behind the nearby supermarket.
Good place to go to Barcelona, a lot of space for cars to Park and ask them for a ride

This is one of the best spots in Manresa to go to Barcelona! We tried the two  roundabout more in the north before for 1h15 but it was not working.
So we mooved and get a course in 2 min!! 
The spot is perfect with great space for the cars to stop before the roundabout.
After walking a bit without any succes, i stopped there and someone stopped almost immediately.
The spot is perfect. Shade, slow speeds and good visibility, just not a lot of traffic. Third car that came by picked my up and dropped me right at the bus stop. They were french.
First Car picked us up, enough space to stop, not really representative for spain though
I just asked a woman I overtook while hiking.
Mabye we had luck, but goes home from work to other villages
we were taken easily very fast, waiting at the bus stop
asked around, friendly ppl going all directions, we went zaragoza
Got a ride to hendaye after waiting about 15 minutes but lots of people stopped beforehand offering rides to other places.  Pretty good spot I thought
This spot (parking area in front of the shop) always works for me in direction Valverde!
Spot 10/10 was just walking out to the Highway with my sign out, got a ride all the way to Porto with a free lunch and a trip to a fortress city on the spanish portugese border
I think a lot of people were heading from here to SabiÃ±Ã¡niga, what he had written on board. But we got lucky and got car heading exactly to Ordesa where we wanted to go (we were 2 guys)
I stood around with a "Prullans" sign, but no one was stopping, so I changed it to "Bellver", the previous bigger town, and within 5 minuts a french couple picked me up.
Perhaps it wasn't the best spot, but I got lucky and a romanian tourist on a rented car got me to Santiago. We even went for a drink. I was a young man with a big backpack, alone.
An english priest on a van with his family picked me up in no time. We stopped at some hot springs at La Hermida along the way. I was a young man with a big backpack, alone.
A cop on a big camper van with his wife and daugher got me where I wanted while we had a nice chat. I was a young man with a big backpack, alone.

I didn't even have time to write the sign. A public worker and also yogurt seller took me half way through while she made a couple stops to deliver yogurt. She even stopped at a scenic viewpoint just to show me the landscape. 10/10
I was a young man with a big backpack, alone. The second car that went by picked me up. It was his first time taking a hitchiker and was very curious.
I asked a french family who were hiking alongside if they could take me to the intersection, and they did. I was a young man with a big backpack, alone. They made space for me on the small van.
I was a young man with a big backpack, alone. The second car that went by took me to the start of my hike. He was and older man also going for a hike.
I was a young man with a big backpack, alone. The first car I signalled to got me where I wanted to go. He was a young hiker, curious about my adventures.
I was a young man with a big backpack, alone. A very nice lady on an old van got me close to Reinosa, where I was heading.
I was a young man with a big backpack, alone. A worker on a small van picked me up. He had a sense oh humour.
I was a young man with a big backpack, alone.
We were two young guys with big hiking backpacks. Literally the first car that we signaled to took us to our destination, after stopping to refill petrol.
We were two young guys with big hitchiking backpacks. Traffic goes by very slow here. A very nice lady on a BMW pick us up.
We were two young guys with big hitchiking backpacks. We were going to El Pont de Suert. A couple on an old van pick us up. They even gave me a sandwich.

Second time I do Hitchhiking in figueres, i think this is a better spot then the one 100 metres before, more space to car to see you and more space to car to stop. It was summer, a lot of french cars were passing, a guy bring me to montpellier.
long truck ride

Very good spot for getting to Murcia, in less than 10 minutes I got offered ride over there however as I was going in opposite direction I had to wait little bit longer but still got ride pretty quick all the way up to loja service station
I found a ride to Leon with first couple I asked. Very crowded petrol station with a lot of people going west or east.

My heart wasn't really in this one. It was late enough to know I wasn't going to reach Andorra by nightfall, but I thought I'd give it a quick go before heading into the little restaurant for dinner, and setting up camp for the night.

The spot is a big straight road with excellent visibility, featuring a big, long gravel car park that goes straight up to the road with no barriers, so it's incredibly easy to pull over.

I set a fifteen-minute timer, that's all I wanted to wait. Lo and behold

When i was dropped off by the Mallorcans i was initially nervous, it didnt look like much, but this seemingly empty (albeit very pretty) view point is a surprisingly excellent spot!
You can stand under one of palm trees, behind the barrier before the exit from the view point, be in perfect view of the drivers and in the shade; functionally hitching directly off of the road! I got a ride in under five minutes from a fantastic Catalan man called Juan-Ramon, who took me all the way to Barcelona!

Pretty decent for a small Spanish town! Nice big roundabout with "shady" trees to hide under whilst hitching north, a welcome break from the summer sun. Got a ride from a mallorcan family with no rear window up the road to la repita, or more specifically a random roadside viewpoint on the outskirts of town. but progress is progress!
Probably the best spot to get out of the Puebla. Had sign "Ourense, Santiago"

Last parking before longer road towards Puebla de SanabrÃ­a. Got a ride there. But during the day people mostly go to the beaches, so not many were leaving around noon, more coming to the lake:) afternoon/evening would be easier to getting out of the lake most likely (Sign: Puebla de Sanabria)
Not much place for cars to stop but people drive slowly so they can stop
Good spot to go south, in direction of the Picos de Europa
Waited a bit with sign "Puebla de Sanabria" but then decided to make another one "Zamora" and got then a ride pretty quickly;)

The spot is good, you can see drivers from both roads and they are driving slow. It's still before the highway sign (so legal). Anyway we tried twice before success. In the end we removed all signes and got a driver who was willing to drive us to the next gas station on A-8.
Got a ride in the middle of the night to Lajares after a rave in a volcano. Very fast
got a quick hitch to els 7 gorgs
got to my destiny, easy hitch
got a hitch to ribes from a french couple, very fast, they stopped in the middle of the road
first car picked me up in this place, after a second. My best ride u til now, she took me to france :)
Waited for 20 minutes just after the roundabout with a sign for Pamplona and got a ride to suburbs there.

Great spot on the ramp going straight onto A7. There is a long line of visibility after a roundabout, a broad shoulder for cars to pullover, and decent traffic. I got a ride by a guy from morrocco in 10 minutes with a â€œAlmeriaâ€ sign. 

He drove me to a roundabout near Nijar, where i continued hitchhiking.
second person i asked was going all the way to Calpe. many friendly people, pretty busy and asking around worked well
Many truck drivers and people driving long distances. got a ride to Loja in a few mins by asking around outside.

Fast traffic but a local stopped and took me to Felanitx. He was very worried as Palma seems to Mallorcans to be very far so he wanted to pay for my bus, but I insisted that itâ€™s okay, Iâ€™ll have a hike in the â€œlonely mountainâ€ and see the caves in Felanitx and then head towards Palma afterwards.
Waited 30 minutes to a ride to Castello (but I stopped before because it wasn't my road)
not easy for the cars to stop, I got lucky

i ended up here after a disastrous series of tiny lifts out of barca
the station is massive, loads of trucks (who all told me they couldn't take me with them), gas station where you can ask people, supermarket and apparently showers too
i didnt have time to explore, cus i soon found a lucky lift to madrid, despite i was aim soley to lleida. lucky day for me
some peeps where going to barcelona too, so im sure you can find for both directions
you can go near the red/green lights, at some point there is a crossover to the right were the cars can stop, I've waited for 2 minutes

In front of the gas station.
Pretty good spot.
I don't even know if this counts as hitchiking. I was coming back from a hike and a farmer in a 4x4 went by and asked me if I was going to town and so he gave me a lift.
Good spot. Easy to go south.

Timing very important ! No cars go up to fuentes Sunday afternoon and none come down sunday morning. Best go up sunday morning if hunting season or in the mornings and come down in the afternoon especially sunday afternoon. So few people up there most cars stop though when they see you
Lots of truck drivers go through here
Stand on the entrance to the roundabout to get the people on the entrance and also going round the roundabout
There is a parking lot and a roundabout slowing people down. Many people go towards Ourense and have a stop at the shopping Centre before
Great Spot for the last bit to Algeciras
If you want to go to the coast, from elche, thats your spot
Great spot to elche
Good spot. Make the text!!

We (Boy & Girl) asked around and some people go to Bilbao and other Places but we figured the next bigger gas station is smarter :) 
We just asked a woman to take us there and she kindly did ðŸŒ±

A nice guy picked us up, he even got us some food. There was no metro because of the catastrophic flooding in Valnecia and he was volunteering there. 
Betera in general is a good spot to hitchhike ðŸ˜ðŸŒ±
There is a bus stop, lot of traffic even on late hours. We were two and got a lift straight to Barcelona after 5-6 minutes using a thumb.
Best spot for cars to stop if you are going to Palma

Itâ€™s good spot, some places for car. There are a traffic light and lot of car can see you. 
Nice to escape this city to go in the south. :)
Not a lot of place for the car but itâ€™s possible before the autoroute. To go in the south you have 2 options, autoroute or national. We waited 10 min to go in the south !
We waited around 2-3min to road to st Sebastian, very good spot ! To go in the east ðŸ«¡
Got taken on the first car I asked
Gas station - first person took me in (Iâ€™m Spanish speaking)

Bus stop with plenty space for cars to stop.
(First time hitchiking btw ðŸ˜)
2 girls Making stop with a sign. Safe place and easy for the cars to stop.

space for cars to stop
sign for Alicante
ride near to the city. from there, either keep hitching or take a local bus into town
Very good spot with the fancy gas station!
I thing it's better than the spot near the roundabout, because there is enough space to stop for the car. You just need to be pationed and use the sign. Good luck!
There is an old beautiful road to get there form the station you dont need to jump any fances just ask locals ;-) the easier spot around Barcelona

There's a space next to the road where people can stop safely and it's on a straight road so the cars have  plenty of time to spot you and think about it.

I got to France easily. Not so Manny people passing by than in the main highway of Girona but a great possiblity to get to Perpignan.
Very quick spot. The on ramp feeds from the petrol station with cars waiting at the roundabout so it was very quick to find a ride.
We needed to go to Malgrat so we placed ourselves in the ramp for that direction: a lot of sun but quick success
Great spot also for international travel
THIS SPOT IS AMAZING! So many cars and many going to Madrid. You need two people to ask all the drivers. Spots like these make hitchhiking easy in spain

Almost got a ride to Marseille there after a few minutes. Some cars going to Netherlands too. After an hour I got one to malaga. 
Cars are coming regulary, you can speak to them at the gas station. I think its a good spot to be dropped of
We instantly got picked up, but I think we were really lucky. But not a bad spot because of the shops and traffic. We went to la Duquesa.
He said its illegal, but in my opinion very fast ðŸ˜ˆ

Everyone goes to andorra, thereâ€™s place to stop. People see you from afar.

A local has said to me everyone gets rides here to Andorra.

This is a tricky spot for andorra.
Iâ€™ve been here at the evening and slept here and at the morning got a hike almost to andorra.

Iâ€™ve talked a few hours with the staff, this is my reconnoissance findings:

Multiple cars a day are Andorrans going straight to andorra. Mainly in the morning 9-14.
Spaniards also go here to Andorra.

If youâ€™ll be patient, youâ€™ll find a hike to Andorra. Itâ€™s also easy to go to manresa, but if you go to andorra you shouldnâ€™t waste this place.

Thereâ€™s woods

There is an old abandoned restaurant here, which allows cars to stop easily. And as it's directly on the way to Portugal for many cars from Huelva, it's a great place for them to pick you up.
I waited here for 10 minutes and got a ride to a rest station right on front of the border.
Sign: A 49

This is maybe the best gas station in the area.
Itâ€™s open 24h and has a (great) restaurant. It is super known and frequented by trucks. Thereâ€™s also a fair amount of tourists that do 100km+ rides. The trucks literally stand in line for you.
A lot of trucks go to valencia.
People do go to Gandia from here, also trucks, but youâ€™ll need to search for it.

I havenâ€™t been to the other side of the highway but it seems identical for those going west.

Eventually a couple from Andorra (approached

This is an amazing gas station for:
Murcia, elche, alicante and almansa!

Thereâ€™s a big gas station and big parking area with a few restaurants.
I got here and found a truck for elche in no time. Thereâ€™s a considerable amount of people coming and leaving.

The only trucks that will go to valencia from here are trucks that had to unload in a place nearby before so itâ€™s less common.
To get to valencia, this isnâ€™t so good as you might think, because the main highway for valencia is up north.

Good for cars who go West in the coast road, and easy to stop with the gas station 
To go the reverse direction there's also a bus stop just in front 
A bit of walking from Zumaia to get there but it's easily accessible with a pedestrian path so very safe
Good spot to go to Valencia or Alicante, lots of space for cars to stop, traffic is slow enough to notice you. Just make sure you have a sign :)
Tre bona loko Ä‰ar antaÅ­e ne foriris aÅ­tojn. Sed tie aÅ­toj venas el multaj direktoj al Vitorio.
1 person with a sign
1 person, take a sign with the name of the city you want to go because in Spain people don't do hitchhiking.
many tourists going to the national park
Many tourists here, don't expect to get a long hitch but you'll get to the villages around and can hitch on from there
Didn't even have time to write a sign, lots of people passing good spot with a good visibility has a small shop also
While walking, trying to find a spot I just pointed my sign at a car coming down the road and he picked us up and drove us to st.jean
Got a lift to Salamanca so quickly !!!!
While walking out of Erro I got a ride to one of the next Villages. This day I made it step by step from Erro through Toulouse to Montpellier...
ÐœÑ‹ ÐµÑ…Ð°Ð»Ð¸ Ð²Ñ‚Ñ€Ð¾ÐµÐ¼ Ð² Ð±ÐµÐ½ÐµÑ„Ð¸ÑÐ¸Ð¾, Ð¿Ð¾Ñ‚Ñ€ÐµÐ±Ð¾Ð²Ð°Ð»Ð¾ÑÑŒ 15 Ð¼Ð¸Ð½ÑƒÑ‚ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ð¾Ð±Ñ‹ Ð¾ÑÑ‚Ð°Ð½Ð¾Ð²Ð¸Ð»ÑÑ Ñ‡ÐµÐ» ÐºÐ¾Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ð¹ Ð´Ð¾Ð²Ñ‘Ð· Ð´Ð¾ Ð±Ð»Ð¸Ð¶Ð°Ð¹ÑˆÐµÐ¹ Ð´ÐµÑ€ÐµÐ²Ð½Ð¸
great spot to get rides on the MA-13 got a pickup from the 4th car that went past!

Seems like hitchiking works really well all along the road from Sitges to Barcelona, at least the one that runs along the sea, I don't know about the autopista further inland.  The other day first car that drove past gave us a lift to El Prat.

I didnt wait at all, a few cars passed, and the first one to stop was going to Coin
And the second one, to Ronda, which i went with
Didnt had any objectif beside go more east, i Guess i was lucky
The main truck parking for this highway in this region. A lot of trucks are parking here, you can easily get rides. Only if you are hitchhiking alone, since trucks have only 1 seat.
For going to finisterra, people stop immediatly so kind!
Lots of cars passed going back to Granada. There is plenty of space for stopping.
Lots of cars goin to GuÃ©jar Sierra
asked exactly 4 people for a ride to Bilbao and we got it in like 8 minutes. it's a 24/7 gas station, so if you get stuck here, you have a place to go and eat.
No one pick us up, actually, a man passing by saw us and invited us to follow him to his car. Then he rode us to Toledo. Very good people
Not the busiest gas station but you can also stand just befpre the ramp andincrease your chances of getting picked up

We were three coloured and entertaining souls who met in Leon on the way to Chaves Portugal. We walked from the center, shopped at Lidl which opens 9am, waited almost 2 hours with a sign "Benavente".
Drivers smiled and waved a lot. Police came by the parallel street and warned "you can't stay here, walk back before the roundabout". After 3 minutes a young guy picked us up and drove us much much much out of his way to Puebla de Sanabria, where PB gas station and restaurant 24/7 is saving us from

I got a ride from the center of Santiago to here and in 20 minutes I got another ride to Vigo! It was perfect! 
It's a spot with a lot of people stopping but you have to have iniciative and ask people if they can take you with them! Good luck :)
HerÃ©s a good spot to go to Conil and Cadix, people stop easily. Only it wasnâ€™t my way so had to hitch back up and down to another exit
Very good spot to go anywhere south or east. Two cars stopped but I prefered to walk yowards Veher ya, because itâ€™s a nice hike.
Good spot to go to Puerto. There is a bridge, so you can stay in the shadow.
Got a ride, from Marc and Eve, that initially should have just taken me to Salamanca but ended up taking me all the way to Seville on my way to Morocco. Good spot honestly.
Failing to get a ride in Valladolid, I walked to Simancas, and there, just walking in the street, met Samuel who gave me a ride to Tordesillas. From there quickly got a ride south to Seville.

Walked from the coast, hitch hiking, finally got a ride from a nice lady to Meruelo, biggest inland borough before the bay of Santander. Don't count on this spot though. It was poorly chosen. The fact remain that Cantabria is a great region for hitchhiking, because people here feel generally quite relax and nice.
Amazing spot. Got a ride very fast. Cantabria in general works great for hitch hiking from my experience. Unlike Asturias :)
Not much traffic around here but very friendly locals
Not that many cars, but they have to go slow and a lot of space to stop. Probably best spot in town. Got a lift to Madrid.

Perfect spot to andorra. Huge service station for cars and trucks.
We were two (M and F), and it took us 5 min to get a direct ride to andorra. Also, I think you can directly ask to people, but we were too lazy to live the shade, so we just waited at the exit of the parking with a sign
It is great place, because its the main road, and enough space for cars to stop. We were going to Lugo and get lifted in 5 minutes, maybe lucky but fine.
The only problem is that there are not much care. Seems that we got lucky
Everybody goes to Lisbon from here, there is a restaurant where many people stop, really good place
scored a jackpot all the way to vigo from here, but could have also just been stupid luck. also there is a restaurant where theres cheap tortilla to lift the spirits

Good place to catch a long distance ride with cars heading all the way to Madrid or Pamplona. There is quite a bit of truck traffic too. This area also has a very decent and cheap buffet (â‚¬8/person as of July 2023), so a lot of people driving from Barcelona stop here. This is a local spot and there arenâ€™t many foreigners, so knowing Spanish or Catalan is important. The best strategy is to talk to people at the gas station but standing with a sign on a ramp leading to the highway works too.

Direction - Valencia, Sunday afternoon.
About one-two cars seen per minute, but unexpected fast one of them hitched me right there I was going.
You're visible and there are enough space to stop. Take a ride easy to the north!
Take a ride to la Seu in a few minutes!
A good spot if you want to go to Valencia. Cars slow down on the lights   and I catched the car to Teruel within 15 minutes
There's a petrol station. I asked the people if they are going to Seville, on the third car the answer was positive!
Very good spot at the S'Avall property enterance, fairly frequent traffic with lots of people slowing down to speak / take interest, got a quick and easy ride to Campos

LleguÃ© durante la noche y ya no venÃ­a mucha gente, pero entre los que habÃ­a muchos iban muy lejos - hasta Alemania, BÃ©lgica (todos pasando por Paris). Algunos van con el coche lleno pero seguro que pillas uno con sitio, y mÃ¡s rÃ¡pido durante el dÃ­a
Un restaurante con un montÃ³n de gente yendo o para Valencia o para Zaragoza. ConseguÃ­ un coche hasta Bilbao
Grat spot to return to the main towns if you come from doing the Pedraforca peak. Space to stop from both directions, the 1st car stopped.

Asked 2 tourists cars and got a ride.
Not too many cars on a Sunday.
its a caravan park area - a lot of travellers are parked around there. If you're lucky, you can meet one about to leave. If you're not...

we were coming from south (Tarifa, Sevilla), and used this spot to change west.
found a ride to Badajoz

if you need to camp over night, seems to be a chilled olive grove behind the charging station for electric cars.
Its a really good spot to go to north - carceres etc.
It's a good spot to go in direction of Sevilla, or maybe Madrid. But it's really not the best to stop if you're going in direction of Portugal.

The best spot in this region to start a mid-long trip in many different directions: Portugal, north of Spain, Seville or Madrid. If you are in the city, you can do all the way to the spot walking. It won't be more than 5 km. But if you aren't on the mood, you can take the bus. Buses 7 and 8 lead  to "Avenida de pitagoras". Then go to the west and ask for the path "Calle del Palo" (it isn't on this map, but it exist). At the end of this way you can find two big petrol stations where you can ask f

we got here late in the evening and decided to camp by the lake behind the gas station, and hitch in the morning, towards Portugal. found a ride do Merida. good place, there was a lot of traffic in this highway
also keep in mind that this is one of the rare service stations with a bridge :). and the staff is really nice. they helped me convince a driver to take me to algeciras ^^

Works well also for the direction Jerez/Cadiz/Algeciras. If you're going to Algeciras, it's recommended to find a direct ride here rather than taking a shorter ride along the highway towards Algeciras.
Great spot! Got a ride with the first car I asked and it took me halway between Sevilla and Huelva.

A lot of cars and trucks, but no good spot to cath all of rhem passing by. I was walking around asking people, then standing near the petrol station, then walking again and finally a guy I had already asked once took me.

I arrived there during the night/morning and spend night behind the gas station. There is one "nice" place where you can sleep under the "roof".
Second day one columbian truck driver saw me from the road and returned to pick me up to Lleida(he was going to Barcelona then)

2 boys HHed there a truck going to Barca in 30 min, however, to me the spot is not really the best, you can only ask or stop people from the gas station, there's not much space for people from the road to stop. But If you speak a bit Spanish or you're alone or two girls the spot is good enogh and according to wiki its not really easy to get out of Zrz to Barca so possibly the spot is even great :)
Perfect place for hitching in both directions - Madrid and Barcelona. Big parking for autopista and national road, lot of cars and trucks. We hitched a lift to Barcelona in nearly 15 minutes.
Second time I use this spot, second time i get in Girona. This one was very lucky, I waited 1 minute. With a Sign is better
